poem:
### Tariffs and Threads

Upon the tangled loom,  
a weaving of words and weights—  
Trump's swift needle punctures  
the fabric of exchange.

In sudden turmoil,  
the clatter of dollars drop—  
an apple bruised by tariff's bite,  
as continents turn,  
spindle-held,  
between shadow  
and shine.  
Through borders, whispers weave—  
Commerce's fragile flight.
